title: Understanding the relationship between volume and temperature in isobaric processes
text: An isobaric process means that the pressure remains constant. For an ideal gas, the relationship between pressure (P), volume (V), and temperature (T) is given by the ideal gas law: $$PV=nRT$$.

title: Using the equation for an isobaric process
text: Since the pressure is constant, we can rearrange the ideal gas law as follows: $$\frac{V}{T}=constant$$ or V_1​/T_1​=V_2​/T_2​. This equation shows the relationship between initial and final volumes and temperatures in an isobaric process.

title: Solving for the final temperature
text: Using the equation $$\frac{V_1}{T_1}=\frac{V_2}{T_2}$$, solve for $$T_2$$ (the final temperature).
